title: How do so many people, crack the UPSC in Bihar? - Quora

response.answer_text: Bihar or Bihari, hearing these two very words will bring to your mind a plethora of adjectives and nouns, one of which will be UPSC. How do so many people crack UPSC in Bihar? The explanation to this is quite simple. Being Bihar, the most UPSC crazed state of India, students of this state start to prepare for civils right after they join college for graduation. They also get ample support from family when it comes leaving their existing job in order to prepare for UPSC. But why? Why this is not the case with Haryana or Gujarat where so many people represent country in sports or start their own business respectively? I state that there are things profoundly peculiar to each state and it gets passed in the generations to come. The culture we belong to and the legacies passed down by our forebears shape the patterns of our achievement in ways we cannot even imagine. The IAS officers of Bihar do owe something to parentage and patronage. They are the beneficiaries of hidden advantages and cultural legacies that allow them to pick civil services, learn history, polity and other subjects of arts and work hard and make sense of the world in ways others cannot. Various Reasons for their advantageous position are as follows: High humanitarian values compared to people of other states: Magadh or today's Bihar lay at the centre of middle gangetic plain. From 6th century BC, people here have been farmers and cultivators and one essential requirement of cultivator society is mutual bonding between families of the village. This works well during the time of sowing seeds and harvesting crops as you need people who can help you in the process. Due to the Agrarian society that existed here for generations, Biharis inherited humanitarian values in their genes. Compare this with Haryana, haryana was inhabited by family of warriors who fought for their king in battle of panipath, sonepat etc. They inherited genes which made them good at physical activities and are relatively more of aggressive temperament compared to people of other state.Risk aversion attitude: Government job means security. Ask any family in Bihar, the most eligible batchelor is the one with government job. Scoring a government job means scoring secure future. Why biharis have tremendous attachment with secure future? Again it can be traced back to the Agrarian society in which we have been living since 6th century BC. Cultivator societies prefer peaceful life , prosperity and a secure future over excessive luxury and working to fulfil too many expectations.Prefence to power over money: Patliputra of Magadh was the capital of India and enjoyed prominent position till the era of Harshavardhana of Vardhana dynasty. Over this period the land of magadh produced many great personages like Aryabhatta, varahmihira, Kalidasa , Chanakya etc. Biharis grew up listening to stories of power and are more emotional to power than money.Value given to education: The existing society of Bihar is dominated by farmers and service providers. Most of the farmer familes today own mere patches of land due to overpopulation. These families attach more importance to education and ensure that their kids excell at academics. Many kids of these poor farmers can be spotted preparing for UPSC in Mukherjee Nagar and living their family's dream.Hardworking nature: Another trait of the genes that we inferited from our farmer forefathers, Biharis often dont shy away from working hard. They understand the risk of losing all their investment and are aware of the background they belong to.Since Gupta period, Bihar excelled in Sanskrit, arts and literature. Today Bihar is known for producing able administrators who play lead role in efficiently running the country. Again Coming back to How do so many people crack the UPSC in Bihar? It wont be wrong if I tell you that Our tradition helps us a lot in this. ;) Ankit Tanmay Mishra

Biharis are really clever people. PRELIMS EXAMAs expected, the question paper is leaked and distributed to all the people from Bihar. All the people from Bihar have a Whatsapp group where the PDF of the question paper is uploaded. 2. MAINS EXAM It’s no secret that Biharis have to struggle hard to converse or write in English. So it is impossible to even comprehend the Mains question paper for them, leave alone cracking this stage and moving on to the interview. Some of the valiant Biharis use nearly invisible headphones. The answer with the correct spellings are dictated to them by IAS’ and IPS’ from Bihar, who believe in returning the favor they received in their respective appearing years. 3. PERSONALITY TEST/INTERVIEW This is where it gets a little violent. Almost every Bihari has a criminal background and this comes in handy at this stage. They walk into the interview armed with the modern weapons. The interviewers are heckled and threatened. They are given two choices - either to award the required marks or to lose their lives. Most of the interviewers make the wise and informed decision and hence, our latest IAS/IPS/IFS/IRS/IAAS from Bihar is born. This is the answer you wanted, right? Of course, none of the above is correct. Most of the people from Bihar who crack the UPSC are from poor backgrounds and work their ass off to be a civil servant. Most of the aspirants have no choice but to prepare for this exam. There are no private companies operating in Bihar. Government services are still where most of the opportunities lie. Most of the aspirants do not have a business to inherit from their fathers. These exams are like a do or die situation for them, if they want to have a decent life. There are no IT companies in Bihar. Hence most of the aspirants are oblivious to the plethora of opportunities that lie in the IT sector. And the government exams are still looked upon as the gates to a well settled life. There is insurmountable hype for these exams and aspirants make sure they give their best. Like people from every other state, Bihairs put in a lot of efforts to crack this exam and that is the sole reason why they are in abundance in the civil services.

Please visit Mukharjee Nagar, Kamla Market or nearby Vishwavidyalaya metro area of Delhi. It’s mini Bihar there. Discuss with some of the Student. I’m sure 6 out of 10 people would be from Bihar and preparing for different competitive exams. They live in tiny rooms.Pay rent 2000–5000 per month.They can be awake 16–18 hours holding competitive books.Their favorite food is called DBC.Dal-Bhaat-Chokha (Pulse-Rice-mashed Potato) (Go Big or Go Home, room look like this. Representative image) They have no option but to study, study & study.Many of them belong to poor farmer's family, but have a big dream.They know how it feels to have nothing. So, there is a burning desire in everyone’s heart.They have no option but to crack the exam anyhow.They are not fit for big MNC, so they have to study for UPSC or SSC.They are not going to Pub for fun but to coaching centers to learn.You may find some of the student turns to tea vendor, egg sellers or fruits/vegetable sellers in evening. Some of them are part time teachers. They are working hard to become officers. One of my friends, who cracked SSC, was a worker at shop of folding bed. He is now assistant at External Affairs Ministry.  So, comparing all the hard working students with some filthy rich or criminal minded, is injustice to them. By the way, given name never appeared for UPSC. She is in custody. It is inefficiency of authority who are not able to maintain the sanctity of examination. Rather than putting blame on Students, they must answer how papers got leaked? What were they doing? Why they are not able to protect the papers?

Well…so you are jealous about UPSC results from Bihar. You came to know that there are alternative ways to clear exams as Ruby Rai did. But let me tell you that There is no connection between UPSC & Ruby Rai. Ruby Rai never appeared in UPSC. In 2014, Total 83 candidates were from Bihar in the final merit list of civil services I can answer “How do so many people crack the UPSC from Bihar”. An egg seller youth cracks civil services exam:- Manoj Kumar Roy’s father is a retired peon who used to get a pension of 1000 rupees. “When my father retired as a peon in 1992, he used to get a pension Rs 1,000. Making both ends meet was difficult for him as we were eight siblings. Though I was the youngest of all, I had to discontinue my studies after passing High School. I went to Delhi in 1995 in search of work and started selling eggs at Sector A bus stop of Vasant Kunj. It was followed by selling vegetables and fruits,” said the 32-year-old Roy who has cracked the UPSC. Satyendra Dubey:- He was an IES officer from Bihar got killed for exposing corruption in NHAI. He was a proud alumnus of IIT K & IIT BHU. A Son of MLA Cracked UPSC & became IAS:- Dr. Vivek is son of JDU MLA.He secured 80th rank in UPSC. He failed twice in interviews, but finally made it.Bihar IPS officer creates ‘Silent Pages’ to keep India’s history alive:- Vikas Vaibhav is an IIT K graduate & a doctorate in History. He is well known for maintaining discipline & taking strict action. ABhayanand:- He is a former IPS officer from Bihar. He used to run the Super 30 class for IIT JEE. EDIT:- I have given these examples just to give you a glimpse of students from Bihar. You can see that some belong to Extremely poor background, Some belong to the influential Political background also, Some attended Premier Institutes of the Country (IITs, IIMs, AIIMS, JNU etc.). You will not find any Rubi Rai type candidate in the list.Thanks for your warm response. There are thousands of motivational stories from Bihar. These stories are very similar to stories from any other state because there is no alternate way. you have to sweat hard to crack UPSC. That’s it. So Bihari work hard just like any other students to crack UPSC. Hope It helps.

How do so many people, crack the UPSC in Bihar? Answer is simple: They work hard to achieve what they want in life. There is no rocket science in cracking UPSC exams. Only dedicated and focused studies in realizing one’s dream. Furthermore, among the government job it is one of the highly coveted jobs as one can reach the pinnacle of bureaucracy in India by virtue of being an IAS officer. Union Cabinet Secretary is the top bureaucrat in the country, as per order of precedence in Indian Polity. Only an IAS officer can become Union Cabinet Secretary or Chief Secretary at state-level. Not just in UPSC exams, but you can find a Bihari excelling in other competitive exams such as IIT, IIM, CBSE-PMT, AIIMS, CDS, Bank PO so on and so forth. Furthermore, in Bihari Society government job is considered to be secure job which is unaffected by slow-down or recession of any kind. So from the aspect of job-security it has a high appeal. Another reason which could be attributed towards high demand of government jobs among Biharis is due to lack of private-sector opportunities within the State. This further reinforces the high-demand for a government job vis-a-vis private sector job. My father himself stood 2nd in All-India entrance exam in the year 1977 for entry into the field of Merchant Navy. Incidentally, 1st ranker in that exam too was from Bihar :) Job opportunities in India based on geo-political situation and local factors also contribute immensely in choosing a career whether it is a private-sector job or government job.I have done my intermediate schooling and graduation from Mumbai, surprisingly I seldom found any student desirous of appearing for UPSC or even IIT (despite having IIT-Bombay at Powai). Most students in Mumbai were focused on getting a job in private-sector or corporate world or pursuing higher education from overseas with settling down in a 1st world country in mind. One can pretty much conclude that job opportunities available in geographical vicinity also shapes up career choices of many students, however exceptions are always there. PS: I am a Bihari residing in ‘Mayanagari’.

You can’t compare Rubi Rai to the people who have cracked UPSC or UPSC aspirants from Bihar. If you are doing so ,it means you are making fun of our national service commission, which selects the pillars of the country who are responsible for the smooth run of of all sectors of the country like: economics, administration, diplomatic relations with foreign countries etc. According to my observation, UPSC mostly chooses or prefers to choose those candidates who have a wide range of opinions and solutions of problems of Indian society,who can understand Indian politics and can work for society in the existing politics, have a wide opinion of Indian history, literature etc. Now coming to the students of Bihar who have cracked or will crack UPSC. The Bihari students have a better sense or they are having intense interest of all of these subjects because they mostly come from rural areas,they don’t only see the pictures of poverty but feel them;pictures of unemployment;background of a helpless farmer who merely are just able to feed their family;their locality are surrounded by historical stories like birth of Buddhism, birth of Jainism, growth of Sikhism,Nalanda university, Gandhiji’s first movement in champaran and many more.Most important ,they live in an extreme of bad administration or political environment.All these mould many Bihari students to revive the history of Bihar,work for the society for its betterment and they see UPSC as the best way to fulfill their burning desires. So many of them choose this as their career during their childhood only. Apart from all these ,everyone knows about the hard work of Bihari students.Once they decide something they do everything to achieve the same.You can see them in Mukherjee Nagar,Delhi.This is a mini Bihar only.Here, they study day and night for UPSC . After all these if one is comparing true Bhari UPSC aspirants with Rubi Rai,it's a shame. Thank you!

Uh..So many people hankering after our long preserved secret. It has remained with Biharis since 1805 when our great great ancestor Gonu Jha decided to pen down the formula of his success. But you people, proud Non-Biharis, want us to part with it. We won’t. Yes we have a formula. Even the ISI can’t trace it. What do I hear? -Please…. Your Family is blackmailing you to be an IAS. Not my problem. Yes we are welcoming and humble. So what? Ok . Just for old times sake… Hm. First get up and find the nearest spot where you can chant the mantra. Be careful in choosing the place because it has to be peaceful. Now take a pen and paper. I am going to dictate it to you. Be quiet. Do not make noise. Now take your pen. Be careful to use only two rupees pen. We are poor people so our ancestor decided to vest special powers in that pen. Now write the following in your notebook . . . . . H-A-R-D-W-O-R-K. Good Luck. On a serious note. Biharis are normal humans living in underprivileged conditions. We are just as capable as other Indians. Do not mock our failures or question our successes. I don’t think that in any part of the world does the speech practice or accent of a community become a cause for failure, or has reaped the status of a laughing stock. Be it either maithili, angika, magahi or for that matter even bhojpuri. A Bihari is as much an Indian as someone from Andhra Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Chandigarh, Chattisgarh, Delhi, Goa, Gujarat, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Kerela, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Orissa, Punjab, Rajasthan, Sikkim, Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Tripura, Uttar pradesh, Uttarakhand, West Bengal, Lakshadweep, Andaman and Nicobar, Daman and Diu or Puducherry. And you have as much chance of becoming an IAS as a Bihari.

Biharis! They are goons… such an illiterate cheap mindset! They are of criminal background, all of them own a buffalo atleast and become a security guard at Delhi! They don't read for UPSC ! At preliminary round they bribe the centre and get the question out , at mains they buy the centre and cheat the exam and at the interviews … they come with a gun, that they put infront of the interviewer and the rest is done without uttering a single word! Isn't this what you you were wishing to read? But the reality is way apart! Like any other Indian they too work hard to crack the UPSC , it's just that their number is higher than the candidates from the other states, all because of the fact that public sector is the only available sector at Bihar as no big private sector companies are there yet. And let me clarify you buddy we Biharis including Rubi Rai crack UPSC from Bihar , not in Bihar! As the BSEB topper scam put the present condition of state education at secondary level to the country… that does not mean all students are of same qualifications who can't differentiate between political science and home science or they won't study at all yet will top the board! Grow up !

Hi bihari here, There are lots of reasons that togetherly as a whole is responsible for this pattern We bihari value power over money. A person holding good position get more person than one having good money.We are comparatively more economically weaker, so a lot of things are at stake and only option is success. We know that a person with no other option and no backup can achieve anything if he gives his full effort.Our culture is such that even uneducated persons are more interested in politics rather than bollywood gossips. So very comfortable with Civil syllabus and patternOur educated system is not so good. An outsider can only know this after topper scandal but we hav ebeen dealing this since initial childhood. We either had no teachers to teach subjects or have single teacher to teach all subjects. So only option was to read as many standard books as possible. This habit again prove to be strength for many UPSC aspirants.We are not in a habit to deflect due to diversions. So it help us to focus and achieve the goal

Statiscally, about 11–13% of the UPSC CSE qualifiers hail from Bihar. I think this is inline with Bihar's population percentage in India. Anyway, the reason why they keep qualifying is because that's what their culture approves of. Power worshipping and colonial mentality. In Bihar, no one appreciates an entrepreneur who has given jobs to 100s of people but they will respect a District Magistrate, no matter how corrupted he/she is. I qualified in IIT JEE and went on to join IITB. Yet many people in Bihar told me that unless you qualify for the UPSC, it's of least value. Bihar does not respect entrepreneurship and private jobs, hence students flock to government jobs and UPSC. Being IAS in Bihar gives you a God type status. Naturally you will give your everything to crack it.There are people who have written IAS exam for 10 years. It's no surprise that their pass percentage is high. Almost every bright student is dragged into the race. They never think of becoming successful innovators or businessmen. All they want is to be IAS/IPS. It is also one of the reasons for Bihar being a backward state.

Firstly, you also need to consider the number of applicants from each region. A vast majority of the UPSC aspirants are from Bihar. Just to quote a small statistic, during my Delhi days, I had a lot of friends who came from this region (8–10). All of them have appeared or are still appearing for Civil Services Examination. So did many of their friends whom I came to know through them. Secondly, most of these candidates come with a single minded focus. Their sole motive is to join the civil services; they have no Plan B in their mind. They study throughout the year, 12–15 hours a day. When you prepare for something in such a dedicated manner, even the universe conspires to turn your dreams true. On the contrary, most of us are lost in the myriad of social networks. Thirdly, a vast majority of these aspirants come from families of limited means. They know they can’t afford coaching and accommodation in Delhi. For them, UPSC is an escape route from their life of poverty and misery. They know how it feels to have nothing. So, they channelize all their efforts towards clearing civil services examination, as they know it will lead to a better life.

I take this question as a sarcastic way to present a doubt (which in this case is quite obvious ) that even though the education policy of bihar is fumbling (Rubi Rai case), how it is still able churn out large number of Civil servents every coming year ( UPSC results 2017: Many from Bihar make it to civil services) ? Let me clear your doubt. Rubi Rai is a clear case of corruption and ignorance on part of Bihar government in its school education policy. But we can’t take away the effort and hard work of those students who make it through successfully and end up getting into good colleges, in and outside bihar. Due to lack of industry, the opportunity in private sector is quite less in bihar. This leaves public sector as the only hope for the large number of graduates passing out every year. And what better than Civil services, which puts you at the top of all public sector jobs. This is the reason why we see cities like Patna, Delhi and Allahabad crowded with UPSC aspirants coming from all corners of bihar in which a handful clears the examination. Let not Rubi Rai define the sincerity and dedication of other students of bihar. There are lot others who define it in true sense. (Please take google’s help to find them, you’ll find many).

Rubi Rai tops in Bihar this how so many people crack UPSC in Bihar? Who do you mean to say by these words? UPSC board takes bribes from rankers to give them ranks. Rubi Rani topped in Bihar because of bribery. And not all students give bribe to top. Its just very few who have reach and money. UPSC exams are conducted by GOI. Do you think they take bribes to pass candidates? If they do then all candidates who top bribe, if not then none bribe. And all the examiners are not from Bihar that they pass others on merit and Biharis by taking bribes. Biharis are genuine talent snd hard-working. Thats what is the reason for them being successful in UPSC. There is no link between Rubi Rai and UPSC. If you think both has some relation then you are raising doubt over the whole selection process of IAS/IPS.

Because they are supposed not to do so. Yeah! You read it right. When you under estimate someone and think that it’s not their cup of tea, that’s when a winner is born.  For example - If I keep telling you, that you belong to a village and hence you can’t be fluent in English, either you will accept it or you will start working hard to prove me wrong. Luckily the former happens in most of the cases . Along with this, Biharis have a unique capacity of adjustment and this makes them unbeatable. So, it all depends on the dream ,will power and sometimes also the level of mocking and bullying. Hope you got my point. Thank you. ~Chitransh.

I heard this from one of my college professor. one day one of my classmate asked the professor, 'Why So many biharis get selected in upsc and other reputative competitive exams?' to which he replied,”We usually think about at least 2-3 attempts and prepare for these exams and our parents are also okey with this(some are exception) ,but in case of biharis the thing is that they are told that you have only one attempt for this or you have to leave your studies . So they prepare very hard as they know they have got only one and last chamce that can decide their whole future life. I don't know how much it's true or not but this may be the real reason in some cases.

haha you question is very interesting, before ansswering you should be awareee of rubi's case she never wanted to be top in class 12, all she want is to pasa 12th but she was a victim of conspiracy, 1.her uncle(mausa) was chief in bihar board office 2. he want her daughter to be passes with good marks without get noticed 3 so he made rubi rai first and gave a decent marks to her daughter. now come for upsc 1.this exam is not only paper based, there are many other phases also 2.suppose some how one is succeed in leaking qp of upsc which is impossible. 3.then also ge have to face interview which is not a piece of cake. so my friend no one can do cheating in upsc exam. Biharis are hardworking so they get success.

This is so because there is too much of corruption in BPSC .Ram Kishore Singh, an Ex member of BPSC caught asking for 25 lakhs for the post of DSP on phone call.His voice sample has already been matched last year,still he is free because of our so called ‘Sushashan Babu’. Actually ,Singh is close ally of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar.Singh has been MLC from Nitish’s Party -JDU .So,hard-working and poor students of Bihar having dream to work as administrative officer left with no option but to go for UPSC. This is the basic reason .All Dal-Bhat-Chokha terms are just fancy words.People want to see Bihar in poverty ,and some show them poverty of Bihar. Although,Bihar does not have industry but situation of agriculture is good.You shall never hear about suicides of farmers in Bihar. Majority of people are poor but those poor Biharis are much aware of things that’s happening in country.

Rubi Rai cracked UPSC. Are you making fun of Civil services & Union Public Service Commission or Bihar??? First get yourself clear on that. Now Rubi Rai topped Bihar Board exams & later the scam was revealed so no longer one can claim that she is the topper.Corruption prevails in every nook & cranny of our country & Bihar is also a part of it.Rubi Rai….the “Prodical Scientist” is just an example of it. It feels extremely bad that corruption has become a part of our education system also but every year Bihar gives many honest civil servants who give their 110% to make our country better in every sphere. Now I won’t give statistics about Biharis cracking civil services because it is All India Services & every individual cracking it should be foremost considered an INDIAN .

There is only one credible examination all over the country and that is UPSC. Please don't have a bit of doubt on credibility of UPSC examination. However coming back to ur query!! Rubi rai was supported by political figure and principal of her school. She was rightfully exposed by media, a big thanks to them as she met her deserved fate. Have u ever heard of an UPSC qualified bihari, who is unable to showcase best of his knowledge?? None….i hope. If yes please do let me know. One thing needs to be kept in mind Ruby rai or the latest arts topper from bihar are just a small faction of corrupt students who try to achieve success with evil means but there are many more apart from those unscrupulous factions who work hard day in day out to achieve success. You cannot compare arvind kejriwal with the rest of population in delhi, can you? (Let alone the political debate its just an opinion) Trust me my dear friend being a BIHARI, these events of corruption hurts me much more than you because i live in some other state away from my home state. However nitish govt. has improved the image of bihar upto a much larger extent after the chaos of Lalu and his ministers. Whether its liquor-free state, the knowledge hub of patna after kota in india for IITJEE preparation. Biharis work hard no matter whether its as a student, a CIVIL SERVANT, or as construction labour.

Why are you Pointing Bihar only? All the aspirants who clear UPSC have such ability to do so. Cheating is a black spot in our education system we should not support it wherever it is being done. But it's also wrong to point iut only one state. MADHYA PRADESH   Haryana  UTTAR PRADESH Himachal Pradesh  Odissa  Now ask how does students of these states manage to clear UPSC. P. S.- I am not supporting these acts but i am against that you are Pointing Bihar only. Yes they did wrong but that doesn't means all students from Bihar manage to clear exam by using these unfair means.

It seems you are jelous about Biharis. just kidding.!! I would like to illustate this with the following example - Have you ever seen a dam. Yes, dam. So when the wall of dam becomes weak, the villages nearby makes holes in the wall in order to reduce the pressure on the wall. Please try to understand this analogy. So, other developed states there are many such holes already created so that the wall does not collapse. You must be thinking what the heck I am talking about these holes? These holes are nothing but opportunities. Rest of the states dave many , Employment opportunities. For Bihar, The thing which remains is Civil services examThekedaari ( taking government contracts )Rangdaari ( asking for protection tax - kind of Mafia )Government jobsSo, more number of students are going to UPSC, This might not be by choice but also by compulsion.

Anyone is free to make an RTI request to Government of India and can file PIL if they think USPC is biased toward Bihari . UPSC is not a child’s play, where you can get away with cheating. UPSC is conducted in three steps, Preliminary , written and Interview. Written exams have multiple papers. No one is capable and resourceful enough to cheat and pass in USPC. Bihari not only succeed in USPC but in almost every filed because they are ready to struggle. They put hard work , they struggle and strive for success !

Lack of developed cities in Bihar increases the unemployment.Corporate industries provide an alternative career option for most other states in India Bihar lacks that corporate life . Presence of major rivers throughout the state has led to high population density increasing unemployment. Due to high demand for employment Government exams seems to be a feasible option for the youth. More people write compared to other states so is the selection rate.

Because we are Laborious, Hard working, Intellectual. We live with Mathematics and science. Anything which comes on our way we try to make a solution for it. We know that if we do not clear there is nothing to do for us back home. so we labor hard.

The scenario is changing very fast. Just do a comparision with TN. You would realise that cumulative no of IAS officers in both states are approximately similar.(In Fact Tamil Nadu would exceed Bihar)  Data has been fetched from DOPT’s Site : CSE Candidates' Information Central Filter used is State Domicile.Data is for IAS officers and not all civil servants

The whole background was prepared by the same media who , remained involved with previous Govt ,who successfully portrayed Bihar ,a criminal minded , after 1975 JP movement .The fact is Bihar being the first State who ended one family rule on India, And people of India tested a true democracy In spite of the very presence of SO-CALLED Highly literate (not educated) peoples.This is highly unfortunate,that the state provided 40% of natural resources and painted as criminal state ,just because of paid media's Own pigments of imaginations.Thanks for making Bihar more stronger day by day.

1) A small clap for the guy who has asked this question. 2) Pathetic questions from a fool whose thinking ends up very low. 3) Not even interested to answer your question buddy. Good luck!! You have a better future ahead!! ;)
The question itself is wrong. Rubi Rai didn't top UPSC but 12th boards. Please people read the question before writing sentimental answers.

Rubi rai..r you kidding..I don't know if you are asking ds question out of innocence or ignorance…rubi rai is a 12 th pass out who did so by cheating..she was in da news for all the wrong reasons regarding da Bihar board exams…
It is not true in present time.students from Rajasthan and uttar Pradesh are more successful in comparison to Bihari studemts
